snippet.textDisplay: Although the plot of Shadow Hearts I + Covenant is far superior, I prefer FtNW regarding to others aspects including music. In Covenant, "The Fate", "The Past" and "Alice Theme" are very good tracks, but the dungeons and battle themes of FtNW excels.
snippet.textOriginal: Although the plot of Shadow Hearts I + Covenant is far superior, I prefer FtNW regarding to others aspects including music. In Covenant, "The Fate", "The Past" and "Alice Theme" are very good tracks, but the dungeons and battle themes of FtNW excels.

snippet.textDisplay:
I don't care what people say, the FF13 series was awesome! Especially 13-2, with an epic antagonist like Caius. And I know your comment is five years old, just thought I'd agree lol

Still, Shadow Hearts 2 will definitely always not just be my favorite game, but also my favorite story in general (closely followed by Milton's epic poem Paradise Lost).
snippet.textOriginal:
I don't care what people say, the FF13 series was awesome! Especially 13-2, with an epic antagonist like Caius. And I know your comment is five years old, just thought I'd agree lol

Still, Shadow Hearts 2 will definitely always not just be my favorite game, but also my favorite story in general (closely followed by Milton's epic poem Paradise Lost).

snippet.textDisplay: Love 1:29
snippet.textOriginal: Love 1:29

snippet.textDisplay: @CannibalusTrollamus Yeah! I miss RPGS like this! I don't like how everyone wants all this real time battles in all rpgs now. They're not as fun, especially when you can't use awesome and unique battle systems like this game had. I had fun playing games where you had to plan and strategize your battles. All the new games are way too easy now compared to old rpgs. I guess people are just too lazy to get the hang of random battles and intricate, yet fun systems.
snippet.textOriginal: @CannibalusTrollamus Yeah! I miss RPGS like this! I don't like how everyone wants all this real time battles in all rpgs now. They're not as fun, especially when you can't use awesome and unique battle systems like this game had. I had fun playing games where you had to plan and strategize your battles. All the new games are way too easy now compared to old rpgs. I guess people are just too lazy to get the hang of random battles and intricate, yet fun systems.

snippet.textDisplay: @CannibalusTrollamus She's not too hard if you keep at her stock constantly, and make sure your characters are always at least near max health. I was at level 58 the first time I beat the game, and I didn't find her too hard.
snippet.textOriginal: @CannibalusTrollamus She's not too hard if you keep at her stock constantly, and make sure your characters are always at least near max health. I was at level 58 the first time I beat the game, and I didn't find her too hard.

snippet.textDisplay:
It should be noted that the theme is actually named "Lady's Tears II", for anyone looking it up.

And yes, it does continue off of Lady's Tears I, which is for the final cutscene before the last boss
